00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)

00084 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00085 
00086 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00087 
00088 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00089 
00090 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00100 
00101 {
00102     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00103     spl_t flags;
00104 
00105     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00106 
00107     adeos_load_cpuid();
00108 
00109     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00110         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00111             {
00112             if (!flags)
00113                 {
00114                 clear_bit(cpuid, lock);
00115                 rthal_sync_irqs();
00116                 adeos_load_cpuid(); /* Could have been migrated by interrupts. */
00117                 set_bit(cpuid, lock);
00118                 }
00119             else
00120                 rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00121             }
00122     else
00123         flags |= 2;
00124 
00125     return flags;
00126 }
00127 
00128 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00129 
00130 {
00131     if (!(flags & 2))
00132         {
00133         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00134 
00135         rthal_cli();
00136 
00137         adeos_load_cpuid();
00138 
00139         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00140             {
00141             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00142             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00143             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00144             }
00145         }
00146 
00147     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00148 }

00150 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00151 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00152 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00153 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00154 
00155 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00156 
00157 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00158 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00159 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00160 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00161 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00162 
00163 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00165 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00166 
00167 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00168 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00169 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00170 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00171    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00172    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00173    timer interrupt instead. */
00174 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00175 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00176 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00177 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00178 /* Using 3/4 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00179    experimentation that proved to fit on tested x86 platforms with
00180    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00181    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00182    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00183 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 3 / 4)

00186 #define XNARCH_ROOT_STACKSZ   0 /* Only a placeholder -- no stack */

00224 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00225 
00226     /* Kernel mode side */
00227     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00228     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00229     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00230     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00231     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00232 
00233     /* User mode side */
00234     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00235     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00236 
00237     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00238     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00239     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00240 
00241 } xnarchtcb_t;

00259 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00260     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00261 }
00262 
00263 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00264     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00265 }
00266 
00267 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00268     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00269 }
00270 
00271 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00272     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00273 }

00276     return adeos_processor_id();
00277 }

00283 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00284 do { \
00285     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00286     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00287     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00288     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00289 } while(0)

00294 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00295 
00296 {
00297     spl_t s;
00298     splhigh(s);
00299     splexit(!!imask);
00300     return !!s;
00301 }

00305 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00306                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00307                                                    void *cookie),
00308                                    void *cookie)
00309 {
00310     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00311 
00312     if (!err)
00313         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00314 
00315     return err;
00316 }
00317 
00318 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00319 
00320     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00324 
00325 {
00326     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00327         return -EINVAL;
00328 
00329     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00330 
00331     return 0;
00332 }
00333 
00334 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00335 
00336 {
00337     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00338         return -EINVAL;
00339 
00340     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00341 
00342     return 0;
00343 }

00346     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00347 }
00348 
00349 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00350     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00351 }

00353 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00354 
00355     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00356 }

00370 
00371 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00372 
00373 {
00374 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00375     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00376 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00377     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00378        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00379        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00380        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00381        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00382        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00383     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00384 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00385 }
00386 
00387 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00388                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00389     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00390 }
00391 
00392 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00393 
00394 {
00395     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00396 
00397     adeos_load_cpuid();
00398 
00399     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00400        and always inside a critical section. */
00401     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00402     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00403     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00404     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00405     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00406 }
00407 
00408 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00409     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00410 }
00411 
00412 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00413                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00414                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00415                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00416                                     )
00417 {
00418 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00419 
00420     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00421         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00422         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00423         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00424         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00425         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00426         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00427         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00428         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00429         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00430         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00431         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00432         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00433         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00434         "ret\n\t" \
00435 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00436         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00437         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00438       : /* no output */ \
00439       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00440         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00441         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00442         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00443         "b" (out_tcb), \
00444         "S" (in_tcb), \
00445         "a" (outproc), \
00446         "d" (inproc));
00447 
00448 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00449 
00450     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00451     
00452     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00453         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00454         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00455         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00456         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00457         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00458         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00459         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00460         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00461         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00462         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00463         "ret\n\t" \
00464 "1:      \n\t" \
00465       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00466         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00467         "=S" (esi_out), \
00468         "=D" (edi_out), \
00469         "+a" (outproc), \
00470         "+d" (inproc) \
00471       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00472         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00473         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00474         "m" (in_tcb->eipp) \
00475       : "ebp");
00476 
00477 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00478 }
00479 
00480 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00481                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00482 {
00483     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00484     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00485 
00486     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00487         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00488            bit need to be cleared. */
00489         clts();
00490     
00491     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00492 
00493     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00494         {
00495         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00496 
00497         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00498 
00499         if (!inproc->mm)
00500             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00501         }
00502 
00503     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00504 
00505     stts();
00506 }
00507 
00508 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00509                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00510     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00511 }
00512 
00513 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00514     /* Empty */
00515 }
00516 
00517 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00518 
00519 {
00520 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00521 
00522     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00523         {
00524         clts();
00525 
00526         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00527             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00528         else
00529             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00530         }
00531 
00532 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00533 }
00534 
00535 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00536 
00537 {
00538 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00539     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00540 
00541     if (task)
00542         {
00543         if (!task->used_math)
00544             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00545 
00546         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00547            hardware. */
00548         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00549         }
00550 
00551     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00552        user-space or kernel thread. */
00553 
00554     clts();
00555 
00556     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00557         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00558     else
00559         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00560 
00561 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00562 }
00563 
00564 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00565                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00566                                          const char *name)
00567 {
00568     tcb->user_task = current;
00569     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00570     tcb->esp = 0;
00571     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00572     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00573     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00574 }
00575 
00576 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00577 
00578     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00579     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00580     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00581     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00582     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00583     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00584 }
00585 
00586 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00587                                                int imask,
00588                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00589                                                void *cookie)
00590 {
00591     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00592     stts();
00593     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00594     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00595     entry(cookie);
00596     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00597 }
00598 
00599 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00600                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00601                                        void *cookie,
00602                                        int imask,
00603                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00604                                        char *name)
00605 {
00606     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00607 
00608     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00609     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00610     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00611     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00612     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00613     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00614     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00615     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00616     *--(*psp) = 0;
00617 }
00618 
00619 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00620 
00621 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00622 
00623 {
00624     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00625        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00626 
00627     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00628 
00629     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00630         {
00631         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00632         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00633         }
00634 }
00635 
00636 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00637 
00638 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00639 }
00640 
00641 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00642 
00643 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00644 
00645     while (!*flagp)
00646         {
00647         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00648         schedule_timeout(1);
00649         }
00650 }
00651 
00652 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00653 
00654 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00655 
00656     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00657 }
00658 
00659 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00660 
00661 {
00662     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00663                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00664                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00665                                      NULL,
00666                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00667 }
00668 
00669 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00670 
00671 {
00672     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00673                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00674                                      NULL,
00675                                      NULL,
00676                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00677 }
00678 
00679 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00680 
00681 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00682 {
00683     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00684 }
00685 
00686 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00687     
00688 {
00689     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00690     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00691     unsigned long flags;
00692     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00693 
00694     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00695 
00696     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00697        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00698        context. */
00699     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00700                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00701 
00702     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00703     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00704     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00705     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00706 
00707     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00708         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00709     
00710     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00711                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00712 }
00713 
00714 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00715 
00716 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00717 
00718     return 0;
00719 }
00720 
00721 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00722 
00723     return 0;
00724 }
00725 
00726 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00727 
00728     return 0;
00729 }
00730 
00731 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00732 
00733 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00734 
00735 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00736 
00737 {
00738 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00739     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00740        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00741     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00742 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00743     xnshadow_release_events();
00744     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00745     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00746     schedule_timeout(50);
00747     xnarch_release_ipi();
00748 }
00749 
00750 static inline void xnarch_escalate (void) {
00751 
00752     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00753     adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00754 }
00755 
00756 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00757 
00758     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00759 }
00760 
00761 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00762 
00763     kfree(chunk);
00764 }
00765 
00766 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00767     
00768     xnshadow_grab_events();
00769 }
00770 
00771 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00772 
00773 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00774 
00775 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00776                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00777                                            const char *name)
00778 {
00779     struct task_struct *task = current;
00780 
00781     tcb->user_task = task;
00782     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00783     tcb->esp = 0;
00784     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00785     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00786     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00787 }
00788 
00789 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00790 
00791 {
00792     unsigned irq;
00793 
00794     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00795         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00796                              handler,
00797                              NULL,
00798                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00799 }
00800 
00801 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00802 
00803 {
00804     unsigned irq;
00805 
00806     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00807         {
00808         switch (irq)
00809             {
00810 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00811             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00812             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00813             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00814             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00815 
00816                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00817                 continue;
00818 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00819 
00820             default:
00821 
00822                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00823             }
00824         }
00825 }
00826 
00827 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00828 
00829 {
00830     unsigned irq;
00831 
00832     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00833         {
00834         switch (irq)
00835             {
00836 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00837             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00838             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00839             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00840             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00841 
00842                 continue;
00843 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00844 
00845             default:
00846 
00847                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00848             }
00849         }
00850 }
00851 
00852 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00853 
00854 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00855 
00856 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00857     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00858        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00859        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00860     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00861 }
00862 
00863 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00864     rthal_release_timer();
00865 }
00866 
00867 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00868 
00869 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00870 
00871 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00872 
00873 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00874 
00875 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00876 
00877 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00878 
00879 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00880 {
00881     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00882 
00883     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00884     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00885     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00886 
00887     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00888 }
00889 
00890 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00891 
00892 {
00893     int err;
00894 
00895 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00896     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00897        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00898     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00899 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00900 
00901     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00902 
00903     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00904         return -ENOSYS;
00905 
00906     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00907                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00908                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00909                               NULL,
00910                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00911 
00912     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00913 
00914     err = xnshadow_init();
00915 
00916     if (err)
00917         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00918 
00919     return err;
00920 }
00921 
00922 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00923 
00924     xnshadow_cleanup();
00925     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00926     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00927 }
00928 
00929 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00930 
00931 #ifdef __cplusplus
00932 }
00933 #endif

00941 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
